definition: mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units

sentences.english: This signpost tells the way to the zoo.
sentences.chinese: 這個路標說明去動物園的道路。

sentences.english: What is written on that guidepost?
The Education Centre is signposted at every crossing in the college.
sentences.chinese: 該大學的每個十字路口處都設有通往教育中心的路標。

sentences.english: The symbol signs can be used for signage & wayfinding projects.
sentences.chinese: 該標誌可用於標識和路標的項目。

sentences.english: "It is a signpost for vaccine development, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 首個艾滋病疫苗是疫苗研發的路標。

sentences.english: Teachers are landmarks, set an example and a direction.
sentences.chinese: 教師是路標，以身作則，指引方向。

sentences.english: The road signs confused the driver.
sentences.chinese: 公路上的幾個路標把司機搞糊塗了。

sentences.english: The life does not have the guidepost, all directions decided by you.
sentences.chinese: 人生沒有路標，一切方向由你決定。

sentences.english: Where shall we wait for the on-site bus? Over there. Please look for the road sign.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該在哪裏等園內巴士？在哪裏。請重視看路標。

sentences.english: But there are guideposts that can help point the way out.
sentences.chinese: 但是，幫助指路的路標還是有的。

sentences.english: Why is there a giant catfish on top of that sign for Paris, Tennessee?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼田納西巴黎鎮的路標上會有一隻巨大的鮎魚？

sentences.english: There are always signs and the other things.
sentences.chinese: 總有路標等其他的東西。

sentences.english: Roadblocks are sign-posts letting you know that success is just around the corner.
sentences.chinese: 路障是讓你知道成功就在這個角落附近的路標。

sentences.english: The performance of road marking paint prepared under these conditions is excellent.
sentences.chinese: 根據最佳反應條件製備出的路標漆性能優良。

definition: to make a detour/to take the long route
Kenting National Park on the Hengchun Peninsula 恆春半島|恒春半岛[Heng2 chun1 Ban4 dao3], Pingtung county, south Taiwan
pinyin: Ken3 ding1 Guo2 jia1 Gong1 yuan2

definition: the road back to where one came from
lit. to see a gap and stick in a needle (idiom); fig. to make use of every second and every inch
